abstract.text: A regex component that attempts to transform a matched substring, saving
the result if successful and backtracking if the transformation fails.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You use a
component to capture part of a match as a
transformed value, when a failure to transform should mean the regex
continues matching, backtracking from that point if necessary.
The code below demonstrates using
to include a test that the
value of a capture is over a limit. In the example,
matches a dollar sign (
) followed by one or more digits, a period
), and then two additional digits, as long as that pattern appears at
the end of the line. The
block wraps the digits and period,
capturing that part of the match separately and passing it to its
closure. That closure converts the captured portion of the
match, converts it to a
, and only returns a non-
value if it
is over the transaction limit.
When the
blockâ€™s
closure processes the three
different amounts in the list of transactions, it only returns a non-
value for the $121.54 transaction. Even though the capture returns an
optional
value, the captured value is non-optional.

code: // The type of each match's output is `(Substring, Double)`.

inlineContent.text: Throwing an error from a
closure aborts matching and propagates
the error out to the caller. If you want to capture the
results of a
failable transformation, instead of continuing a search, use
instead of

abstract.text: Use an expressive domain-specific language to build regular expressions,
for operations like searching and replacing in text.
A regex component that saves the matched substring, or a transformed result,
for access in a regex match.
A reference to a captured portion of a regular expression.
A regex component that attempts to transform a matched substring, saving
the result if successful and backtracking if the transformation fails.
The output type for this regular expression.
Creates a capture for the given component using the specified
reference, attempting to transform with the given closure.
